title: Contributing to rpaleoclim
text: rpaleoclim free open source (FOSS) software maintained interests open science. Contributions types welcome.

title: Contributing to rpaleoclim
text: report bug problem, please create new issue https://github.com/joeroe/rpaleoclim/issues. Please include much information possible , can, minimal reproducible example (“reprex”).

title: Contributing to rpaleoclim
text: suggest new feature improvement, please create new issue https://github.com/joeroe/rpaleoclim/issues.

title: Contributing to rpaleoclim
text: contributions welcome, possible please follow conventions: R code, follow tidyverse style guide documentation, use roxygen2 add new functionality, write unit tests testthat Run devtools::check() build package run tests making pull request follow GitHub flow make pull request contributions.

title: Contributing to rpaleoclim
text: questions comments software, please feel free email maintainer joe@joeroe.io.

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: can install development version rpaleoclim GitHub using remotes package: depends terra, turn requires recent version system libraries GDAL PROJ. included binary releases terra Windows MacOS, build source (e.g. Linux) might need install first; see terra README instructions different systems.

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: rpaleoclim provides R interface download data listed http://www.paleoclim.org/ currently mirrored http://www.sdmtoolbox.org. tables last updated 2022-02-16; please refer PaleoClim website authoritative version. notice change update PaleoClim data structure isn’t supported current version package, please report : https://github.com/joeroe/rpaleoclim/issues.

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: PaleoClim includes climate reconstructions simulations following time intervals, supplemented two additional datasets CHELSA:

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: PaleoClim uses 16 standard “bioclimatic variables” conventional coding:

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: options resolution : "10m": 10 minutes, c. 16 km 30° N/S "5m": 5 minutes, c. 8 km 30° N/S "2_5m": 2.5 minutes, c. 4 km 30° N/S "30s": 30 seconds, c. 1 km 30° N/S (available "cur" "lgm")

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: Use paleoclim() download paleoclimate data PaleoClim, specifying desired time period (see ) resolution. example, download data Late Holocene ("lh") 10 min resolution: result SpatRaster object 19 layers containing reconstructed values standard “bioclimatic variables” (see ) period. Consult terra documentation information working spatial raster data R. default, paleoclim() loads entire downloaded raster R, .e. whole globe. can conveniently crop specific (rectangular) region interest region argument. can specified SpatExtent object anything coercible one (see ?terra::ext), includes spatial data types, simply vector coordinates (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax): already downloaded data PaleoClim simply want read R, can load_paleoclim(), passing path .zip archive:
code: library(rpaleoclim) library(terra) #> terra 1.8.54 paleoclim("lh", "10m") #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 1044, 2160, 19  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.1666667, 0.1666667  (x, y) #> extent      : -180.0001, 179.9999, -90.00014, 83.99986  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> sources     : bio_1.tif   #>               bio_10.tif   #>               bio_11.tif   #>               ... and 16 more sources #> names       : bio_1, bio_10, bio_11, bio_12, bio_13, bio_14, ...  #> min values  :  -526,   -334,   -656,      0,      0,      0, ...  #> max values  :   314,    385,    288,   9696,   2399,    651, ... europe <- c(-15, 45, 30, 90) europe_lh <- paleoclim("lh", "10m", region = europe) #> Reading cached PaleoClim data from /tmp/Rtmppj4CG4/LH_v1_10m.zip #> ℹ Use `skip_cache = TRUE` to force redownload.  plot(europe_lh[["bio_12"]], main = "Late Holocene annual precipitation, Europe") zipfile <- system.file("testdata", "LH_v1_10m_cropped.zip",                        package = "rpaleoclim") load_paleoclim(zipfile) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 6, 6, 19  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.1666667, 0.1666667  (x, y) #> extent      : 0, 1, 0, 1  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> sources     : bio_1.tif   #>               bio_10.tif   #>               bio_11.tif   #>               ... and 16 more sources #> names       : bio_1, bio_10, bio_11, bio_12, bio_13, bio_14, ...  #> min values  :  -526,   -334,   -656,      0,      0,      0, ...  #> max values  :   314,    385,    288,   9696,   2399,    651, ...

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: Note examples , downloaded data PaleoClim servers . Repeated calls paleoclim() ask time period resolution reuse cached versions previously downloaded file. default, files stored R’s temporary directory, download files per session. cached files never modified; subsequent cropping, warping, etc. either done -memory creates new temporary files. cache_path argument controls directory paleoclim() downloads files tries read cached data . can useful change somewhere within working directory reuse files sessions ensure analysis can reproduced future, even remote PaleoClim data changes disappears. skip_cache = TRUE force paleoclim() download files PaleoClim even cached data exists cache_path (case overwrite ). quiet = TRUE suppresses messages whether data downloaded read cached file.

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: Since version 0.9.1, rpaleoclim depended terra package reading manipulating spatial data. Previous versions used raster rgdal, now deprecated. use old raster types, need install optional dependency raster: pass = "raster" paleoclim() load_paleoclim() return data RasterStack object instead SpatRaster. Please note raster support removed future version rpaleoclim.
code: install.packages(c("raster")) paleoclim("lh", "10m", as = "raster") #> Reading cached PaleoClim data from /tmp/Rtmppj4CG4/LH_v1_10m.zip #> ℹ Use `skip_cache = TRUE` to force redownload. #> Warning: `as = "raster"` is deprecated and will be removed in future versions of rpaleoclim #> This warning is displayed once per session. #> class      : RasterStack  #> dimensions : 1044, 2160, 2255040, 19  (nrow, ncol, ncell, nlayers) #> resolution : 0.1666667, 0.1666667  (x, y) #> extent     : -180.0001, 179.9999, -90.00014, 83.99986  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> crs        : +proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs  #> names      : bio_1, bio_10, bio_11, bio_12, bio_13, bio_14, bio_15, bio_16, bio_17, bio_18, bio_19, bio_2, bio_3, bio_4, bio_5, ...  #> min values :  -526,   -334,   -656,      0,      0,      0,      0,      0,      0,      0,      0,     6,     3,   116,  -292, ...  #> max values :   314,    385,    288,   9696,   2399,    651,    215,   6321,   2025,   5128,   3860,   169,    90, 24243,   481, ...

title: Introduction to rpaleoclim
text: Please follow instructions authors citing PaleoClim data. time writing, includes citation paper describing PaleoClim database: Brown, J.L., Hill, D.J., Dolan, .M., Carnaval, .C., Haywood, .M., 2018. PaleoClim, high spatial resolution paleoclimate surfaces global land areas. Scientific Data 5, 180254. doi:10.1038/sdata.2018.254 well original papers individual original datasets used. Use citation("paleoclim") details references BibTeX format.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Joe Roe. Author, maintainer, copyright holder.

title: Download Paleoclimate Data from PaleoClim
text: PaleoClim set free, high resolution paleoclimate surfaces covering whole globe. includes data surface temperature, precipitation standard bioclimatic variables commonly used ecological modelling, derived HadCM3 general circulation model downscaled spatial resolution 2.5 minutes. package provides simple interface downloading PaleoClim data R, support caching filtering retrieved data period, resolution, geographic extent.

title: Download Paleoclimate Data from PaleoClim
text: can install latest release rpaleoclim CRAN : development version GitHub using remotes package:

title: Download Paleoclimate Data from PaleoClim
text: package includes two functions, paleoclim() load_paleoclim(). paleoclim() downloads data PaleoClim desired period resolution reads R SpatRaster object.  default, files PaleoClim cached local temporary directory avoid repeated download data. load_paleoclim() reads local PaleoClim files (.zip format) way. details see introduction rpaleoclim vignette (vignette("rpaleoclim")).
code: library("rpaleoclim") library("terra") # For plotting  paleoclim("lh", "10m") |>   plot()

title: Download Paleoclimate Data from PaleoClim
text: Please follow instructions authors citing PaleoClim data. time writing, includes citation paper describing PaleoClim database: Brown, J.L., Hill, D.J., Dolan, .M., Carnaval, .C., Haywood, .M., 2018. PaleoClim, high spatial resolution paleoclimate surfaces global land areas. Scientific Data 5, 180254. doi:10.1038/sdata.2018.254 well original papers individual original datasets used. Use citation("paleoclim") details references BibTeX format.

title: Load data from PaleoClim — load_paleoclim
text: Loads PaleoClim data file (.zip format) R SpatRaster.

title: Load data from PaleoClim — load_paleoclim
text: file Character. Path *.zip file downloaded PaleoClim. Character. = "raster" returns RasterStack object (see raster::stack()) instead default raster terra package. provided backwards compatibility removed future versions. Requires raster package.

title: Load data from PaleoClim — load_paleoclim
text: SpatRaster object (see terra::rast()) bioclimatic variable separate named layer.

title: Load data from PaleoClim — load_paleoclim
code: file <- system.file("testdata", "LH_v1_10m_cropped.zip",                     package = "rpaleoclim") load_paleoclim(file) #> class       : SpatRaster  #> size        : 6, 6, 19  (nrow, ncol, nlyr) #> resolution  : 0.1666667, 0.1666667  (x, y) #> extent      : 0, 1, 0, 1  (xmin, xmax, ymin, ymax) #> coord. ref. : lon/lat WGS 84 (EPSG:4326)  #> sources     : bio_1.tif   #>               bio_10.tif   #>               bio_11.tif   #>               ... and 16 more sources #> names       : bio_1, bio_10, bio_11, bio_12, bio_13, bio_14, ...  #> min values  :  -526,   -334,   -656,      0,      0,      0, ...  #> max values  :   314,    385,    288,   9696,   2399,    651, ...

title: Retrieve data from PaleoClim — paleoclim
text: Downloads data PaleoClim (http://www.paleoclim.org) loads R SpatRaster object.

title: Retrieve data from PaleoClim — paleoclim
code: paleoclim(   period = c("lh", "mh", "eh", "yds", "ba", "hs1", "lig", "mis19", "mpwp", "m2", "cur",     "lgm"),   resolution = c("10m", "5m", "2_5m", "30s"),   region = NULL,   as = c("terra", "raster"),   skip_cache = FALSE,   cache_path = fs::path_temp(),   quiet = FALSE )

title: Retrieve data from PaleoClim — paleoclim
text: period Character. Time period retrieve. resolution Character. Resolution retrieve. region SpatExtent object object can coerced SpatExtent (see terra::ext()), describing region retrieved. NULL, defaults whole globe. Character. = "raster" returns RasterStack object (see raster::stack()) instead default raster terra package. provided backwards compatibility removed future versions. Requires raster package. skip_cache Logical. TRUE, cached data ignored. cache_path Logical. Path directory downloaded files saved. Defaults R's temporary directory. quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses messages download progress information.

title: Retrieve data from PaleoClim — paleoclim
text: SpatRaster object (see terra::rast()) bioclimatic variable separate named layer.

title: Retrieve data from PaleoClim — paleoclim
text: See http://www.paleoclim.org details datasets codings. Data 30s resolution available 'cur' 'lgm'. default, paleoclim() read previously downloaded files R's temporary directory available. Use skip_cache = TRUE override . cache_path can also set another directory. can useful want reuse downloaded data sessions.

what: rpaleoclim: Download Paleoclimate Data from 'PaleoClim' — rpaleoclim-package
title: rpaleoclim: Download Paleoclimate Data from 'PaleoClim' — rpaleoclim-package
text: 'PaleoClim' http://www.paleoclim.org (Brown et al. 2019, doi:10.1038/sdata.2018.254 ) set free, high resolution paleoclimate surfaces covering whole globe. includes data surface temperature, precipitation standard bioclimatic variables commonly used ecological modelling, derived 'HadCM3' general circulation model downscaled spatial resolution 2.5 minutes. Simulations available key time periods Late Holocene mid-Pliocene. Data current Last Glacial Maximum climate derived 'CHELSA' (Karger et al. 2017, doi:10.1038/sdata.2017.122 ) reprocessed 'PaleoClim' match format; available 30 seconds resolution. package provides simple interface downloading 'PaleoClim' data R, support caching filtering retrieved data period, resolution, geographic extent.

title: rpaleoclim: Download Paleoclimate Data from 'PaleoClim' — rpaleoclim-package
text: Maintainer: Joe Roe joe@joeroe.io [copyright holder]

title: rpaleoclim 1.1.0
text: Failed downloads (e.g. due server errors) now return NA warning, instead causing error ‘Getting started’ vignette now precompiled building package generate request Paleoclim data server (#20)

title: rpaleoclim 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2023-08-09 raster (>= 3.5.1) now uses terra (>= 1.5-12) linking GDAL rgdal retired removed CRAN October 2023: https://r-spatial.org/r/2022/04/12/evolution.html

title: rpaleoclim 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-28 Added introductory vignette paleoclim() load_paleoclim() now return terra::SpatRaster instead raster::raster. paleoclim(= "raster") load_paleoclim(= "raster") provided backwards compatibility. require raster installed removed future versions. region argument paleoclim() now expects terra::ext instead raster::extent. extent coercible ext, shouldn’t break existing code. Fixed name period "mis19" ("mis")

title: rpaleoclim 0.9
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package.
